revised_title: Improving the Adjustment of Triple Object-Glasses in Telescopes
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, describes a method to improve the adjustment of a triple object-glass in telescopes. By examining the central adjustment of the lenses and using a series of images formed by reflection, Wollaston developed a way to detect and correct any defective position. This method allowed for better performance in telescopes, enabling the observation of small and distant celestial objects.
